White tile that shows every scuff and water mark.  It's a disneyland location so the modern look and feel seems out of place but it's nice to get away from the Mouse as well. Then there is the freeway nose.  We were lucky to get the quiet side. I could still hear the freeway although it was not bad.  Could they have not used better sound proffing? Breakfast was ok. Eggs were rubbery bit you can always find something to fit your needs.  Staff was friendly.  Pool is now open! Again, modern furnishings by the pool but comfy. A little kid splash area should be opening soon.
Manager Response: Hello tilyt!  Thank you for your visit and your review of our hotel! We appreciate all of our guest feedback as it helps us in improving our hotel and operations. You are correct about the tile and we are replacing them in the near future with materials that will withstand high traffic. It is pretty and gives it a modern look but we agree that it has to be replaced. Our windows are double pane and their are sleep packs available at the front desk for guests who are more sensitive to noise.  We hope that you will come and visit our beautiful hotel again!  Warm regards, Rachel and team at Holiday Inn Express and Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: Superb location, modern, clean and comfortable
Summary: We stayed here as part of our spring break family trip to SoCal from the east coast.  We found the hotel experience better than we expected.  We initially boojed the penthouse for our party of five but it does not include a pullout bed and the hotel doesn't have rollaways.  Keep that in mind   the quickly and efficiently moved us to a suite - problem solved.  Rebecca at the front desk was great with all this.  The location to Disneyland is really convenient.  I have no reservations recommending this hotel for families coming to the Disney parks.
Manager Response: Dear Richard L.,   Thank you for your most recent visit at our hotel! We appreciate the comments regarding your stay and the shout out to our team member Rebecca! We love the recommendations from our previous guests as it is our goal to be recommended and even better if we can welcome them back over and over.  We hope to see you again soon!  Warm regards,  Team at Holiday Inn Express and Suites Anaheim

Summary: The hotel is fairly new, the room was very spacious and clean, the hotel grounds were nice and new, the pool was still under construction so couldn't use that, the hotel offers free breakfest which was good (the first day was okay the second day seemed better), the hotel has minimual parking so just let them valet for you (it's the same price), only about a 5-10 minute walk to Disney. The only downside to the hotel is it's proximtity to the freeway, little freeway noise if you get a room facing the freeway. Our stay was excellent and the staff was very curtious, even gave us late check-out. The beds seemed to sleep stiff, but after a long day at Disney, it was a non issue.
Manager Response: Dear Rayford W,  Hello from the Holiday Inn Express and Suites Anaheim! Thank you for your most recent visit and review of our hotel. We are happy to report that our pool is open! We love that your stay with us was excellent and found our team to be courteous. We appreciate your observations regarding the bedding and room location. As a newly opened hotel, this helps us in improving our operations and procedures.  We hope to welcome you back again, soon!  Kind regards,  Team at Holiday Inn Express and Suites Anaheim

Summary: After a long day at Disneyland we were exhausted and needed dinner. The valet recommended an Italian restaurant that delivers and the food was amazing. The front staff was helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms were beautiful, spacious, and luxurious. Our leftovers fit into the refrigerator and there was a k cup in the room for morning coffee. The hotel was quite and peaceful. The breakfast in the morning was a perfect variety. We could not have had a better experience. Each staff member treated us as if we were important, I liked that. I felt like they appreciated my business. Overall great end to a great day. Will stay here again!!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wonderful new hotel within walking distance of Disneyland. Ignore the bad reviews about the delay in the hotel opening. We had a very spacious room. Two full beds and a very large sleeper sofa. We enjoyed having a table and kitchen area for our take out dinners. Friendly front desk staff. Plenty of options for the free breakfast (eggs, sausage, biscuits, fruit, pancakes, toast, bagels, etc) The only negative would be the bathroom sliding doors. Our toddler likes to open the door and there was no way to lock it from the inside. Parking was $15 a day plus resort taxes and fees which seem excessive for parking.  Just make it a flat rate and don't add an extra $3.50 a day in taxes. We had white noise playing on our phone and could hardly hear the highway. Friendly hotel staff. We
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer W,  Thank you for your most recent stay and review of our hotel. We are very pleased to hear that everything went well from your room, breakfast and staff interaction. We apologize about your concerns regarding the valet fee taxes. The city of Anaheim requires all fees charge to our guest be added occupancy and TID tax.  We look forward to your return!  Sincerely,  Management and team at Holiday Inn Express & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: Nice hotel if you like sleeping on the freeway
Summary: Wow, I had high hopes for this place, since it's new, until I checked in and realized that my room was literally on the freeway.  Even though the room was very spacious and new,  I couldn't get over the freeway noise.  It sounded like trucks were driving through my room all night, even with the AC fan on.  I will never stay here again due to the noise and location.  If you must stay here, ask for a room on the quieter side of the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear TwoTexasTravellers,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay with us. We would like to apologize for the inconvenience caused by the freeway noise during your visit and we also regret your disappointment with our location. We understand the discomfort this has caused you. Rest assured your feedback will be reviewed and most certainly be forwarded to the appropriate departments for evaluation.  We value you as our guest and hope to have another opportunity to provide you with a much better experience.  Sincerely,  Joel A Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Hotel: Easy access to the place. Had no problem finding the front desk and getting room keys. About 5 minute walk to Disneyland. Pool was not ready. Seems like they were still tweaking the outside in terms of landscaping. One Elevator needed to be worked on while on stay for 4 nights. Lasted for about 6 to 8 hours. Only 2 elevators.   Room: King room with sleeper sofa. Room was clean and had all the typical amenities such as cofee maker, mini fridge, lock box, towels, extra pillow/blanket, tv, LAN line, FREE WiFi, desk table, drawers and cabinets. You can hear the noises from the freeway. Once it get closer to 10pm less traffic and noise outside. Wifi would bounce between 4-7MB which is decent for a hotel providing it for free.  Staff: Very pleasant and nice. All seems to be
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel walking distance from Disney parks
Summary: Valet parking very accomodating.  Friendly staff at front desk. Breakfast was great, saves time when travelling with children. Room is clean, beds comfortable. Spacious room, we have two kids and spend a week in this hotel room. wifi works well and its free!!! Keurig coffee machine in room - excellent for coffee lovers like myself. Microwave and fridge in room for guests use - again very useful when travelling with kids.   I would definitely recommend this hotel as I would stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: New property, short walk to Disneyland
Summary: Very nice, clean and new hotel. Room was spacious enough for our family of 5. The beds were very comfortable. Our room had a microwave, mini fridge and a keurig. The staff was friendly and helpful. The check-in process was smooth. The parking was limited and the charge is $15 per day. It conflicts with what was on their website. Also, the pool was not open yet so I can't provide a review on that. The breakfast was good. Cereals, oatmeals, fruits, muffins, pancakes, eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a new HIE near Disneyland. Check in was easy. The room is spacious with comfortable beds. The TV channel selection is good. I had a room that faced the freeway and the noise is quite loud. It didn't bother me, but if you are a light sleeper you should request a room on the other side of the building. I didn't have a car this trip but the previous reviewer is correct about the parking situation. My room overlooked the front lot area and both mornings when I looked outside there were cars double parked all over.   Internet worked fine. Bathroom amenities only included shampoo and lotion. The bathroom had good lighting. The breakfast selection is your standard HIE food (pancake machine, cinnamon rolls, sausage, various bread items, yogurt, fruit, etc) The breakfast area is
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Property, Terrible Parking, Lacks Parking
Summary: The property itself is very nice.  It is a newer property, only open approximately 3 weeks.  The luggage carts are small, but work as long as you only have maybe two people.  The swimming pool was not yet opened.  There was no water in the pool. The express breakfast was nice.  The area to sit for breakfast is wonderful, plenty of room!  Loved everything about the Holiday Inn at this location except for the lack and availability of parking.  The parking is shared with another hotel chain.  Self parking may be equal to 2 blocks away.  The only other option is valet, which is the same cost for self parking, however, the valet has no choice but to triple park behind self parked cars.  In which case you need to ask and wait for the valet to move the cars behind you.  This location
Manager Response: Dear Sunsets_Rock,   Thank you for writing a review about your recent stay with us.  We work very hard to ensure our facilities and service are superior and we strive to be the best Holiday Inn Express around.  It is great to hear that you were satisfied with the complimentary breakfast option and overall accommodations.  Your concerns regarding limited parking have been taken into account.  Please be assured that we are continuously working to improve our facilities.  I sincerely apologize for ay inconvenience these issues may have caused you.  The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas.  We welcome any opportunity to improve.  I value you as our guest and hope you will continue to choose IHG for your future travel needs.   Sincerely,   Lera P Case Manager  IHGService

Summary Heading: Amazing New Hotel Within Walking Distance to Disneyland
Summary: Brand new hotel is now open and it is beautiful!  It opened in February 2016 and it is about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. The suites are large and have a sitting area with couches large enough for 2 small children or 1 adult to sleep on and a bedroom area with a wet bar, microwave, refrigerator and Keurig Coffee Maker with K-pods. I liked the cubbies in the room for your shoes so it gets them up off the floor.  On the beds there were firm and soft pillows labeled with those words on the pillowcases which was really nice.  I was worried that since the hotel was brand new the mattresses would be really firm but they were perfect.  The bathrooms were large also and they had a great shower head. There were plenty of outlets for your electronic items.  A good free breakfast comes
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is all new and everything looked great. My room was a spacious suite with plenty of room and a nice tv with for once a decent channel selection. Internet worked alright but was a little laggy. Plenty of outlets to charge up your devices. Bed is comfy and had plenty of pillows. Only thing I thought was missing from the room was a coffee table for the sofa. Rooms was quiet too. They do take a $50 incidental fee.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean, Quiet but staff not very helpful.
Summary: The drive to Anaheim is insane so when we arrived earlier than our check in and were told our room wasn't ready (king bed) but could have another (queen bed), we quickly agreed.  The room overlooked what I think was the water or furnace system but we didn't care about the view and it was tucked in a corner so we weren't concerned about noise - especially being near Disneyland we expected lots of families to be there and we were right!  But it was quiet so it turned out to be fine.  And the young woman who checked us in was very nice.  We asked her if there was a shuttle to Disneyland, she said there was for a $5.00 fee (well worth it!) and we asked if it was walking distance.  She said yes and that we would likely see families walking there and back and it was about 1.5 miles.
